version_description:
New: Group by feed, kind of. Instead of having a potentially huge list with all items grouped by feed, there's a new pull-to gesture when reaching the bottom of the article list. You now can pull to open the article list of the next feed.
This pull-to

New: Group by feed, kind of. Instead of having a potentially huge list with all items grouped by feed, there's a new pull-to gesture when reaching the bottom of the article list. You now can pull to open the article list of the next feed.
This pull-to

This update should address issues when using a self-hosted service with the Fever API:

- New setting "Refresh on server". Default is ON, this also applies to accounts you have already added in Reeder. If enabled, this will trigger a refresh of all

This update should address issues when using a self-hosted service with the Fever API:

- New setting "Refresh on server". Default is ON, this also applies to accounts you have already added in Reeder. If enabled, this will trigger a refresh of all

What's new:
- Alt text for images (tap-and-hold on image)
- Show URL in share sheet
- Arrow key navigation
- Spacebar and shift-spacebar for article viewer scrolling and navigation

Improved:
- Image viewer now also works for images

What's new:
- Alt text for images (tap-and-hold on image)
- Show URL in share sheet
- Arrow key navigation
- Spacebar and shift-spacebar for article viewer scrolling and navigation

Improved:
- Image viewer now also works for images

WHAT'S NEW:
• Option to group article list by feed
• New appearance options (see settings -> 'Appearance'):
- Hide unread/starred counts in the subscriptions list
- Hide favicons in the articles list
- Hide the text preview in t

WHAT'S NEW:
• Option to group article list by feed
• New appearance options (see settings -> 'Appearance'):
- Hide unread/starred counts in the subscriptions list
- Hide favicons in the articles list
- Hide the text preview in t

WHAT'S NEW:
• Support for Pocket, finally including sync which means you now can use Reeder as a Pocket client
• Automatic Reader View: It's now possible to enable Reader View by default on a per feed basis (see Account settings or tap-and-hold on t

WHAT'S NEW:
• Support for Pocket, finally including sync which means you now can use Reeder as a Pocket client
• Automatic Reader View: It's now possible to enable Reader View by default on a per feed basis (see Account settings or tap-and-hold on t

FIXED:
• Pocket sync issues
• Missing Pocket icon for list swipe action


WHAT'S NEW IN 4.1:
• Support for Pocket, finally including sync which means you now can use Reeder as a Pocket client
• Automatic Reader View: It's now possible

FIXED:
• Pocket sync issues
• Missing Pocket icon for list swipe action


WHAT'S NEW IN 4.1:
• Support for Pocket, finally including sync which means you now can use Reeder as a Pocket client
• Automatic Reader View: It's now possible

IMPROVED:
• Reduced resistance when dismissing the image viewer

FIXED:
• Possible crash when setting Firefox or SnowHaze as default browser
• More Pocket sync issues. Pocket syncing should be completely fixed now. If you're still seeing er

IMPROVED:
• Reduced resistance when dismissing the image viewer

FIXED:
• Possible crash when setting Firefox or SnowHaze as default browser
• More Pocket sync issues. Pocket syncing should be completely fixed now. If you're still seeing er
Bugfixes and improvements for iOS 13
Bugfixes and improvements for iOS 13

FIXED:
• Some article viewer layout issues
• Fever sync issues (again)
• Crash when toggling "sharing only" option for Pocket or Instapaper
• Favicon display issues when automatic appearance (based on system setting) is set

FIXED:
• Some article viewer layout issues
• Fever sync issues (again)
• Crash when toggling "sharing only" option for Pocket or Instapaper
• Favicon display issues when automatic appearance (based on system setting) is set

FIXED:
• Background refresh issues on iOS 13
• Status bar display issues
• Standalone RSS: Refreshing animation not stopping
• Some article links weren't loading in Reader View and in-app browser
• Various minor bugfixes and improvements

FIXED:
• Background refresh issues on iOS 13
• Status bar display issues
• Standalone RSS: Refreshing animation not stopping
• Some article links weren't loading in Reader View and in-app browser
• Various minor bugfixes and improvements

This update addresses an issue with automatic appearance switching (based on system settings) if you have set Reeder's appearance to "Automatic Light/Dark" or "Automatic Light/Black".

Fixed in 4.1.5:
• Background refresh issues on iOS 13
• St

This update addresses an issue with automatic appearance switching (based on system settings) if you have set Reeder's appearance to "Automatic Light/Dark" or "Automatic Light/Black".

Fixed in 4.1.5:
• Background refresh issues on iOS 13
• St
This update addresses a potential issue when importing local RSS accounts from Reeder 3.
This update addresses a potential issue when importing local RSS accounts from Reeder 3.

WHAT'S NEW
• Added FreshRSS (freshrss.org) as a self-hosted sync service option
• "Read Later with Reeder" sharing action to add items to Reeder's Read Later from other apps
• Alternate app icons (see Settings > Appearance)
• Settings for a

WHAT'S NEW
• Added FreshRSS (freshrss.org) as a self-hosted sync service option
• "Read Later with Reeder" sharing action to add items to Reeder's Read Later from other apps
• Alternate app icons (see Settings > Appearance)
• Settings for a

WHAT'S NEW
• Read Later shortcut actions for adding and getting items (iOS 13)
• More alternate icons

IMPROVED
• URL autocompletion when adding a FreshRSS account
• Reader View
• Error messages for the new Read Later extension

WHAT'S NEW
• Read Later shortcut actions for adding and getting items (iOS 13)
• More alternate icons

IMPROVED
• URL autocompletion when adding a FreshRSS account
• Reader View
• Error messages for the new Read Later extension

PLEASE NOTE: This update temporarily disables automatic syncing for Feedly as Reeder was using too much of Feedly's resources. We're working on finding a solution.

WHAT'S NEW
• New shortcut action to open a Read Later item in Reeder

FIXED

PLEASE NOTE: This update temporarily disables automatic syncing for Feedly as Reeder was using too much of Feedly's resources. We're working on finding a solution.

WHAT'S NEW
• New shortcut action to open a Read Later item in Reeder

FIXED
This update brings back automatic/background syncing for Feedly.
This update brings back automatic/background syncing for Feedly.

WHAT’S NEW
- Trackpad support (iPad)

IMPROVED
- In-app browser shortcuts
- Reader View

FIXED
- Crash when renaming a feed
- Crash in “Bionic Reading” settings
- Missing favicons in articles list

WHAT’S NEW
- Trackpad support (iPad)

IMPROVED
- In-app browser shortcuts
- Reader View

FIXED
- Crash when renaming a feed
- Crash in “Bionic Reading” settings
- Missing favicons in articles list

WHAT’S NEW
- Option to automatically hide and show toolbars in the article viewer (disabled by default, see Settings → Reading)
- You now can also filter by domain when using the “Get Items from Read Later” shortcut action
- iPad: It’s now possib
